VariableDescription.Name: R_Helio
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         Helios
#     SOURCE_NAME                     HELIOS-1>Helios-1
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Interplanetary Studies
#     DATA_TYPE                       40sec>40 sec Helios magnetic field and plasma data
#     DESCRIPTOR                      mag-plasma>Merged magnetic field, plasma, trajectory
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     PI_NAME                         R. Schwenn, F. M. Neubauer
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research, University of Cologne
#     TEXT                            General information about initial ascii files: This subdirectory contains daily                        
#     TEXT                             files of 40.5 sec Helios magnetic field and plasma data described below.  It                          
#     TEXT                             also contains a file of software written by Aaron Roberts, readhelios40s_dat.pro,                     
#     TEXT                             for creating alfvenicity graphs.       The Helios mission consisted of two                            
#     TEXT                             spacecraft launched into the inner heliosphere, both executing orbits from                            
#     TEXT                             0.3 to 1 AU with roughly a six month orbital period.     Magnetic field data                          
#     TEXT                             were recorded at high resolution, with plasma data recorded  at approximately                         
#     TEXT                             40.5 s resolution.  These datasets give the highest resolution  plasma (proton                        
#     TEXT                             and helium) moments with the corresponding average magnetic field  for each                           
#     TEXT                             plasma measurement.  There are results from two plasma sensors, one of  which                         
#     TEXT                             gives the vector velocity.         The coverage is best in the early years                            
#     TEXT                             and varies considerably for the rest of the mission.  The files Helios1_stats                         
#     TEXT                             and Helios2_stats give the year, day of  year, number of points, and percentage                       
#     TEXT                             of possible points for the days included  in the sets.  There is no coverage                          
#     TEXT                             for many days, with the main reason being that  the spacecraft pass behind                            
#                                      the Sun with respect to the Earth, thus cutting off  communication.                                   
#                                     The overall intervals covered are:
#                                     Helios 1:  1974 day 346 to
#                                     1985 day 247
#                                     Helios 2:  1976 day 017 to
#                                     1980 day 068
#                                     The present set of files were produced by R. Schwenn and obtained from J. Luhmann.                     
#                                      They have been reformatted by Aaron Roberts to assure spaces between the variables,                   
#                                       and in the process the HGI longitude and the RTN versions of the variables                           
#                                      were added for convenience.  Also, spacecraft positions were interpolated to                          
#                                      make them  distinct. The fill value for missing data in the original files                            
#                                      was either -1 or 0;  all these have been changed to 0. The other entries are                          
#                                      directly from the original  files.                                                                    
#                                     R. Schwenn should be acknowledged for plasma data and F. Neubauer for magnetic                         
#                                      field data.  GSFC/SPDF nssdcftp (or successor) should be acknowledged as the                          
#                                      immediate  source of the data.                                                                        
#                                     * The RTN components were calculated from the SSE XYZ components using R ->                            
#                                      -X, T -> -Y, and N -> Z.  The Cartesian coordinates for B and the angles for                          
#                                      V are the  original variables in the file, and no correction was made in the                          
#                                      conversion to RTN  for the actual spacecraft position.  Since RTN and SSE are                         
#                                      defined relative to the helioequatorial plane and to the ecliptic plane, respectively,                
#                                      and since these planes are inclined by 7.25 degrees relative to each other                            
#                                      (heliocentric orbits of Earth,  Helios 1 and Helios 2 are virtually co-planar),                       
#                                      this introduces errors of up to 100% * (1 - cos 7.25) = 1% in the RTN components.                     
#                                       However, the V and B are consistent with each other and can be compared directly.                    
#                                     (text by Aaron Roberts, with edits by Joe King; October, 2008)
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#                                     Plasma and Solar Wind
#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Helios
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  helios1_40sec_mag-plasma
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 helios-1_40sec_mag-plasma_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Merged 40.5 s magnetic field, plasma data, ephemeris
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 40.5 seconds
#     LINK_TEXT                       Above data in the form of
#     LINK_TITLE                      ASCII files
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://spdf.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/data/helios/helios1/merged/he1_40sec/
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor_yyyyMMdd
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. Heliocentric distance (AU)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:03:35 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Heliocentric distance (AU)
#
EPOCH                         R_HELIO
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms             AU
12-12-1974 01:21:38.000      0.980000

#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  helios1_40sec_mag-plasma
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 helios-1_40sec_mag-plasma_00000000_v01

VariableDescription.Name: Np2
VariableDescription.Header:
#              ************************************
#              *****    GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES    ******
#              ************************************
#
#     PROJECT                         Helios
#     SOURCE_NAME                     HELIOS-1>Helios-1
#     DISCIPLINE                      Space Physics>Interplanetary Studies
#     DATA_TYPE                       40sec>40 sec Helios magnetic field and plasma data
#     DESCRIPTOR                      mag-plasma>Merged magnetic field, plasma, trajectory
#     DATA_VERSION                    1
#     PI_NAME                         R. Schwenn, F. M. Neubauer
#     PI_AFFILIATION                  Max Planck Institute for Solar System Research, University of Cologne
#     TEXT                            General information about initial ascii files: This subdirectory contains daily                        
#     TEXT                             files of 40.5 sec Helios magnetic field and plasma data described below.  It                          
#     TEXT                             also contains a file of software written by Aaron Roberts, readhelios40s_dat.pro,                     
#     TEXT                             for creating alfvenicity graphs.       The Helios mission consisted of two                            
#     TEXT                             spacecraft launched into the inner heliosphere, both executing orbits from                            
#     TEXT                             0.3 to 1 AU with roughly a six month orbital period.     Magnetic field data                          
#     TEXT                             were recorded at high resolution, with plasma data recorded  at approximately                         
#     TEXT                             40.5 s resolution.  These datasets give the highest resolution  plasma (proton                        
#     TEXT                             and helium) moments with the corresponding average magnetic field  for each                           
#     TEXT                             plasma measurement.  There are results from two plasma sensors, one of  which                         
#     TEXT                             gives the vector velocity.         The coverage is best in the early years                            
#     TEXT                             and varies considerably for the rest of the mission.  The files Helios1_stats                         
#     TEXT                             and Helios2_stats give the year, day of  year, number of points, and percentage                       
#     TEXT                             of possible points for the days included  in the sets.  There is no coverage                          
#     TEXT                             for many days, with the main reason being that  the spacecraft pass behind                            
#                                      the Sun with respect to the Earth, thus cutting off  communication.                                   
#                                     The overall intervals covered are:
#                                     Helios 1:  1974 day 346 to
#                                     1985 day 247
#                                     Helios 2:  1976 day 017 to
#                                     1980 day 068
#                                     The present set of files were produced by R. Schwenn and obtained from J. Luhmann.                     
#                                      They have been reformatted by Aaron Roberts to assure spaces between the variables,                   
#                                       and in the process the HGI longitude and the RTN versions of the variables                           
#                                      were added for convenience.  Also, spacecraft positions were interpolated to                          
#                                      make them  distinct. The fill value for missing data in the original files                            
#                                      was either -1 or 0;  all these have been changed to 0. The other entries are                          
#                                      directly from the original  files.                                                                    
#                                     R. Schwenn should be acknowledged for plasma data and F. Neubauer for magnetic                         
#                                      field data.  GSFC/SPDF nssdcftp (or successor) should be acknowledged as the                          
#                                      immediate  source of the data.                                                                        
#                                     * The RTN components were calculated from the SSE XYZ components using R ->                            
#                                      -X, T -> -Y, and N -> Z.  The Cartesian coordinates for B and the angles for                          
#                                      V are the  original variables in the file, and no correction was made in the                          
#                                      conversion to RTN  for the actual spacecraft position.  Since RTN and SSE are                         
#                                      defined relative to the helioequatorial plane and to the ecliptic plane, respectively,                
#                                      and since these planes are inclined by 7.25 degrees relative to each other                            
#                                      (heliocentric orbits of Earth,  Helios 1 and Helios 2 are virtually co-planar),                       
#                                      this introduces errors of up to 100% * (1 - cos 7.25) = 1% in the RTN components.                     
#                                       However, the V and B are consistent with each other and can be compared directly.                    
#                                     (text by Aaron Roberts, with edits by Joe King; October, 2008)
#     INSTRUMENT_TYPE                 Magnetic Fields (space)
#                                     Plasma and Solar Wind
#                                     Ephemeris
#     MISSION_GROUP                   Helios
#                                     !___Interplanetary Data near 1 AU
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE                  helios1_40sec_mag-plasma
#     LOGICAL_FILE_ID                 helios-1_40sec_mag-plasma_00000000_v01
#     LOGICAL_SOURCE_DESCRIPTION      Merged 40.5 s magnetic field, plasma data, ephemeris
#     TIME_RESOLUTION                 40.5 seconds
#     LINK_TEXT                       Above data in the form of
#     LINK_TITLE                      ASCII files
#     HTTP_LINK                       http://spdf.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/data/helios/helios1/merged/he1_40sec/
#     FILE_NAMING_CONVENTION          source_datatype_descriptor_yyyyMMdd
#
#              ************************************
#              ****  RECORD VARYING VARIABLES  ****
#              ************************************
#
#  1. Default time
#  2. Proton density (second instrument)
#
#  
# Key Parameter and Survey data (labels K0,K1,K2) are preliminary browse data.
# Generated by CDAWeb on: Thu Jan 15 19:03:47 2015
VariableDescription.VariableInfo:
#  2. Proton density (second instrument)
#
EPOCH                         DENSITY
dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.ms          cm^-3
12-12-1974 01:21:38.000  -1.00000E+31
